subject: Re: [junit] Test Collector in Junit3.8
msgSnippet: David Saff  wrote: ... Andi, I m a little confused.  Are you using JUnit 3.8.1, or JUnit 4?  What are you trying to do: I m Trying to run the
messageBody:
David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
Andi Mirani wrote:
> Hello,
>
> Is there any one knows how to handle Test Collector due to testing
> file in Junit 3.8.1?
> I have this problem since Junit 4 was launch.

Andi,

I'm a little confused. Are you using JUnit 3.8.1, or JUnit 4? What are
you trying to do:

I'm Trying to run the sample test of Junit, but it seems have problem with "TestCollector". I run it before (1 month ago) and it smooth; Since the Junit4 is launched I could not run it the Junit3.8.1 any more with properly way.
And also the message say "there is no class is found" this message is showed on the bottom of Junit GUI.

what have you tried:
Running the sample file Junit and I have another file that I need to modify. Do you know how do I setup Xalan and Xerces in classpath XP pro? How those is worked with Junit?

and what happens?
I set up the class path with properly and when I runned by type: java junit.swingui.TestRunner; It showed the the GUI but it's hard to test it because I found message say "no test cases found. Checked that the configured 'TestCollector' is supported on this platform". How do deal with TestCollector in thsi case? I really need your help.


Thank's

Andi



Thanks,

David Saff
